edu.neu.ccis.sms.config

Class ConfigurationReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.neu.ccis.sms.config.ConfigurationReader

  • public class ConfigurationReader
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class for retrieving properties from the CompositeConfiguration; containing the entire terminology for the individual web application instance.
    Author:
    Swapnil Gupta

                                          java.lang.String property)
        Get attribute key for given property.
        Parameters:
        attribute - the attribute to be retrieved from given property
        property - the property from which the given attribute needs to be retrieved
        Returns:
        key to get given attribute from given property

      • getCategoryToPropertyKey

        public static java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getCategoryToPropertyKey(org.apache.commons.configuration.CompositeConfiguration terminologyConfig)
        Find all the categories in the terminology config, mapping them to their property key. Starting from root element ( ConfigKeys.HIERARCHY_ROOT_ELEMENT), keep on traversing child elements ( ConfigKeys.HIERARCHY_ROOT_ELEMENT[. ConfigKeys.HIERARCHY_CHILD_ELEMENT]) e.g category.subCategory.subCategory till you traverse all valid properties with the attribute 'name'.
        Parameters:
        terminologyConfig - configuration containing the terminology for current application context
        Returns:
        all the categories mapped to their property keys in the configuration file

      • addAllCategoryToPropertyKeyAtSameLevel

        private static void addAllCategoryToPropertyKeyAtSameLevel(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> propertyKeysToTraverse,
                                          java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> categoryToPropertyKey,
                                          org.apache.commons.configuration.CompositeConfiguration terminologyConfig)
        Get all the categories at the same level (in terminology hierarchy), and append them to the category to property key map. If more than one categories are available for a given property key, they are siblings (at same level) and can be distinguished by using the index e.g (0) after the property key, starting from 0 following their sequence in the config file.
        Parameters:
        propertyKeys - list of all the properties yet to be traversed
        categoryToPropertyKey - mapping from category to its property key in configuration
        terminologyConfig - configuration containing the terminology for current application context

      • getCategoryToHtmlLabels

        public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> getCategoryToHtmlLabels(java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> categoryToPropertyKey,
                                                                                                org.apache.commons.configuration.CompositeConfiguration terminologyConfig)
        Get a map (of all categories in configuration) from category to a list of its html labels All the html labels should be contained within the ' ConfigKeys.CATEGORY_ELEMENT_HTML_LABELS ' element, child of the '(sub)category' element.
        Parameters:
        categoryToPropertyKey - mapping from category to its property key in configuration
        terminologyConfig - configuration containing the terminology for current application context
        Returns:
        a map of all the categories mapped to the list of all its html labels(member attributes)

      • getCategoryToParentCategory

        public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getCategoryToParentCategory(java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> categoryToPropertyKey,
                                                                               org.apache.commons.configuration.CompositeConfiguration terminologyConfig)
        Get a map (of all categories in configuration) from category(name) to its parent category(name). name : ConfigKeys.CATEGORY_ATTRIBUTE_NAME
        Parameters:
        categoryToPropertyKey - , mapping from category to its property key in configuration
        terminologyConfig - , configuration containing the terminology for current application context
        Returns:
        a map of all the categories mapped to their parent categories

      • getAllCategoriesForBooleanAttribute

        public static java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> getAllCategoriesForBooleanAttribute(java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> categoryToPropertyKey,
                                                                      org.apache.commons.configuration.CompositeConfiguration terminologyConfig,
                                                                      java.lang.String booleanAttribute)
        Return a hash set of all the categories in the terminology which have true as value for the given boolean attribute. This is a genric method to get all submittables or all registerables

        Currently used boolean attributes
        ConfigKeys.CATEGORY_ATTRIBUTE_REGISTRABLE
        ConfigKeys.CATEGORY_ATTRIBUTE_SUBMITTABLE
        Parameters:
        categoryToPropertyKey - mapping from category to its property key in configuration
        terminologyConfig - configuration containing the terminology for current application context
        booleanAttribute - boolean attribute we are searching for given category
        Returns:
        a set of all categories which are "boolean attribute"-able e.g for boolean attribute "register" returns a hash set of all registerables

      • getChildPropertyKeyToValue

        public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getChildPropertyKeyToValue(java.lang.String parentProperty,
                                                                              org.apache.commons.configuration.CompositeConfiguration terminologyConfig)
        Given a (parent) property key, get a map of all its child properties mapped to their respective values.
        Parameters:
        parentProperty - the property for which we want to get all its containing(child) properties
        terminologyConfig - configuration containing the terminology for current application context
        Returns:
        a map containing pairs "child property key : value"
